Mr* Graydon Ausmus
Page 2
December 9, 1953
With regard to the LETTER FROM ITALY, we*ve sent you a copy of our letter
to Sy Siegel indicating the impossibility of getting this on our schedule
here until after January.
I hope your trip goes well, and assure you that we will as soon as possible
get you your cards. Thanks for signing the Christmas cards, which have not
yet arrived back at Headquarters, for sending out. We shall take care of
them within the next week.
Sincerely,
Harry J. 9korrda
Executive Director

P.S. - Just in receipt of your two letters dated December 7,
and hasten to reply. Every little while I remind myself
what a hell of a fine gentlemen you are, and this is one
of those times. (Your letter to Waldo, i.e. the earlier
one, almost made me forget it.)
I*ve been telling myself the last couple of days, what you
mentioned, about “too much about overload.” Last few days*
output, I hope, is already more positive* You*re right about
it.
The $2,000.00 ig, inadequate for tapes (we*11 spend not less
than $7,000.00;but I doubt if we should ask members to
contribute until we*ve tried a few tricks first. Can we
hold for a month or two to see how we are doing?
Your suggestion re materials — mailing is excellent.
Postage this month was close to $800.00. Wilco. Got
extra girl, half-time hourly, December 3 to help get
budget analysis. (Be<*i trying to something besides
HwailM already, you see). Will have ready for January 13.
Macandrew, Coleman, Dr. Adams, and Paulu matters are now
all straight, I think, Graydon. And many thanks. In a
couple of days samples of Letters of Agreement, as mailed,
will reach you.
HJSsms
